required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound and Psychobiological Correlates of Female Sexual Function
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Interventional Study on Clitoral Ultrasound Measures and Psychobiological Correlates of Female Sexual Function

brief_summary.textblock: Monocentric pilot interventional study. The aim of the study is to assess clitoral doppler ultrasonographic parameters in a population of sexually healthy volunteer women in order to obtain reference values. Psychobiological correlates of female sexual function will also be studied through hormonal testing and psychological evaluation.

primary_outcome.measure: Clitoral artery peak systolic velocity and acceleration
primary_outcome.description: This will not be evaluated in different time frames but evaluated in order to assess reference values in sexually healthy women and compared with subjects with sexual dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Female sexual function assessed through the Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI)
General psychopathology assessed through the Middlesex Hospital Questionnaire (MHQ)
Body image is investigated through the Body Uneasiness Test (BUT)
Measurement of the thickness of the urethrovaginal space
Measurement of the thickness of the endometrial lining
Hormonal parameters (17β-estradiol, total testosterone, LH, FSH, TSH, PRL, delta-4-androstenedione, DHEAS, 17-Hydroxyprogesterone, SHBG)
Metabolic parameters (total cholesterol, HDL, triglycerides, glycemia, insulin, glycated hemoglobin)

arm_group.description: 20 sexually healthy volunteer women will be enrolled from subjects consulting our outpatient clinic (subjects free from sexual dysfunction). Hormonal and ultrasound parameters and self-administered questionnaires will be evaluated.

intervention.description: Doppler Ultrasound assessment of clitoral hemodynamics will be performed in all subjects. Transvaginal and transrectal ultrasound will be performed in subjects giving their consent to these procedures.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- sexually healthy
- evidence of a personally signed and dated informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- any uncontrolled or unstable, acute or chronic disease
- alcohol or drugs abuse
- sexual dysfunction
- any overt psychiatric or psychological condition assessed through psychological evaluation and/or self-administered validated questionnaires.

facility.name: Ambulatori di Medicina della Sessualità e Andrologia

reference.citation: Battaglia C, Nappi RE, Mancini F, Cianciosi A, Persico N, Busacchi P, Facchinetti F, de Aloysio D. Menstrual cycle-related morphometric and vascular modifications of the clitoris. J Sex Med. 2008 Dec;5(12):2853-61. doi: 10.1111/j.1743-6109.2008.00972.x. Epub 2008 Aug 28.

Battaglia C, Battaglia B, Mancini F, Nappi RE, Paradisi R, Venturoli S. Moderate alcohol intake, genital vascularization, and sexuality in young, healthy, eumenorrheic women. A pilot study. J Sex Med. 2011 Aug;8(8):2334-43. doi: 10.1111/j.1743-6109.2011.02310.x. Epub 2011 May 19.

Battaglia C, Nappi RE, Mancini F, Alvisi S, Del Forno S, Battaglia B, Venturoli S. PCOS and urethrovaginal space: 3-D volumetric and vascular analysis. J Sex Med. 2010 Aug;7(8):2755-64. doi: 10.1111/j.1743-6109.2009.01651.x. Epub 2010 Jan 6.
